{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2981315,"name":"Sam Geckler","username":"sgeckler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sgeckler/{size}/66162_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-12T20:25:43.537Z","cooked":"

As we get more and more detailed autonomous path work opportunities I’d like to know if folks are using any metrics to assess how accurately the robot followed the path. Do you only judge the final position or do you assess accumulated errors along the way? Do you have any developments techniques to share? Do you have any techniques to sort out mechanical related issues to control related? Do you work a path in shorter segments or work the ‘hardest’ segment and use that calibration to run the rest? All seem like good topics to chat about.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2021-12-12T20:25:43.537Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":20,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":137.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":398072,"topic_slug":"path-following-metrics-and-development-process","display_username":"Sam Geckler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21515,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/path-following-metrics-and-development-process/398072/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2981318,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-12T20:39:55.013Z","cooked":"

I’ve never had any need to measure in any more detail than “did the robot accomplish the thing we were trying to do.”

I bet with some of the improved telemetry tooling that we’re shipping to teams these days, we can start seeing some more-detailed error analysis.

A related question to those teams who successfully implemented path following: Do you do Drive train characterization (or SysID) on the actual competition field or a practice field in the tournament, or is the characterization done at the team meeting place sufficient? We do not have carpet and the free space is barely ~ 20 ft long in the robotics room, hence the question.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2021-12-12T22:46:44.210Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":89,"readers_count":88,"score":22.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":398072,"topic_slug":"path-following-metrics-and-development-process","display_username":"roborb","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30609,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/path-following-metrics-and-development-process/398072/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2981335,"name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-12T23:28:43.821Z","cooked":"

To be able to measure the path following accuracy, you need some way of measuring the ground truth robot position (as opposed to the inferred position from the encoders/gyro).

There are definitely ways to do that. In college research I’ve gotten to use cool stuff like mocap studios and drones with cameras detecting ArUco targets. You don’t even need something as complicated as those for FRC. Some kind of triangulation system measuring the distance between a marker on the robot and a few known points around the field.

But I’d argue for 99.9% of teams the time and effort needed to set up a system like this would be better spent on other endeavors.

Another option which I’m curious to try out Marvelmind Indoor Navigation System

For a lot of games how well the path is followed isn’t that important as other parts of the system can compensate for the error. For most paths you are driving from one starting configuration to a vision target, or one vision target to the other. You can sort of “shotgun” it with your path to get your robot pretty close to the right spot, then have the vision system take care of the rest. For a game like 2018 where the scoring points didn’t necessarily have a vision target pathing becomes more important, but it can be argued that this was mitigated by the large size of the switch/scale. Additionally, there were teams that used vision to track cubes during autonomous that year, which would again reduce that path error.

You could also have a mechanical solution that compensates. The wider your intake, the less precise you need to be when picking things up. Or if you have an active scoring mechanism, you can use it to adjust right before scoring.

Path following doesn’t need to be precise as their are other systems that can compensate. As long as the starting and end poses are consistent, other parts of the robot will make up for the rest.
